item.aerobatic-elytra.aerobatic_elytra_w: Only Creative players can use it
aerobatic-elytra.network.kick: Was kicked for sending too many invalid aerobatic flight packets
aerobatic-elytra.recipe.trail.clears_tra:
Rockets without stars clear
the trail for their side
aerobatic-elytra.jei.info.aerobatic_elyt: Press ⟨%s⟩ to change between flight modes
aerobatic-elytra.jei.help.category.upgra: Hold in the offhand and sneak-use ingredients to upgrade
aerobatic-elytra.jei.help.category.dye:
Each wing can be dyed separately
Right click in a water cauldron to clear
aerobatic-elytra.jei.help.category.banne:
A different pattern can be used in each wing
Right click in a water cauldron to clear
aerobatic-elytra.jei.help.category.trail:
A different trail can be set for each of the 4 rockets
Different rocket stars result in different trail styles
Rockets with multiple stars result in a random mix
Beware that mixing many different colors is not the best idea
aerobatic-elytra.jei.help.category.split:
Wings can be separated to be dyed with
different colors or banners
Only matching pairs of wings can be rejoined

The left wing will remain in the crafting table
while the right will be the recipe result
aerobatic-elytra.jei.help.category.join:
Only wings with matching abilities,
enchantments, damage and other NBT
can be merged

commands.aerobatic-elytra.error.no_elytr: None of the targets has an Aerobatic Elytra equipped
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.item.unda: Prevent the Aerobatic Elytra item from suffering any damage
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.aerobatic:
Minimum propulsion in§b m/s²§r
Can be negative (propelling backwards)

Setting this too high (or low) without the
friction to compensate is§l not§r a good idea
You have been warned

Maximum propulsion in§b m/s²§r
Must be higher than the min
Can be negative (can't go forward)

Setting this too high (or low) without the
friction to compensate is§l not§r a good idea
You have been warned

Propulsion when taking off in§b m/s²§r
In case you don't want to have to heat up
Multiplier for the gliding force (caused by the wings)

Friction applied when flying
Applied every tick

Friction caused by rotation
Is scaled by the strength of the rotation

Friction applied underwater to nerfed aquatic elytras
Only relevant with nerfing datapacks

Emulated inertia, probably not what you thought.
Rate to which every tick's speed is interpolated to
the previous tick's.
Setting higher than §b0.5§r is not very enjoyable.
Setting to §b1§r will disable any maneuverability.
Friction applied when flying without propulsion

Extra gravity applied when flying without propulsion
Can be negative (less gravity)

Braking (crouch flying) aids in landing
However, strong winds will drag players when braking
Flying while braking continuously can also
be used to create trail effects

Friction applied when braking
Should be lower than Base Friction

Max time allowed braking in§b seconds§r
Set to 0 to disable the limit

Extra gravity applied when braking in§b m/s²§r
Makes landing easier
Allow players to change flight mode in midair
Enable the normal elytra mode in Aerobatic Elytras
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.fuel.usag:
In§b units/s§r
Scales linearly with the relative propulsion strength
Adds with the other usages

In§b units/s§r
Scales quadratically with the relative propulsion strength
Adds with the other usages

In§b units/s§r
Scales as a sqrt with the relative propulsion strength
Adds with the other usages
Applied to the regular usage when boosting
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.weather:h: Enables rain and wind interferences when flying with bad weather
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.weather.i:
If false, players about the cloud level
won't be affected by weather
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.weather.c:
Y-level at which weather stops affecting players
By default, Minecraft clouds appear at Y=128
Has no effect if Ignore Cloud Level is true
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.weather.r:
Applied when raining
Is affected by the biome:
    Snow is §b×1.2§r times stronger
    In dry biomes there's no rain

How much should the rain push players down in§b m/s²§r
Can be negative (pushes up)

How much should the wind at most blow players around in§b m/s²§r
Nearby players are pushed by the same wind
How much should the wind change direction at most in§b deg/s§r

How much should the wind at most deviate player trajectories in§b deg/s§r
Nearby players get deviated equally
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.weather.s:
Adds to the Rain values during storms
Likewise, it's affected by the biome

How much should the rain push players down in§b m/s²§r
Can be negative (pushes up)
Adds to the rain value during storms

How much should the wind at most blow players around in§b m/s²§r
Nearby players are pushed by the same wind
Adds to the rain value during storms

How much should the wind change direction at most in§b deg/s§r
Adds to the rain value during storms

How much should the wind at most deviate player trajectories in§b deg/s§r
Nearby players get deviated equally
Adds to the rain value during storms
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.network.d:
Disable the Elytra Movement Check for players flying with Aerobatic Elytra
This isn't necessary if the /gamerule already disables the check in general
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.network.a:
Custom Movement Check for players flying with Aerobatic Elytra
Default for regular elytra is§b 300§r, and§b 100§r for non-flying players
Has no effect if the check is disabled above or with /gamerule

Tilt range checks overlook (as a multiplier)
The check takes in account both server and connection lag
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.network.s:
§6⚠ Changing this value won't make you go faster ⚠§r
This is a cap to prevent the world from crashing if you break the other settings
If you ever reach this cap, you'll be notified in the chat
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.network.i:
Max number of allowed invalid flight packets per player
Exceeding this number grants a kick
Set to 0 to disable
aerobatic-elytra.config.server.collision: Applied after the Collision Damage multiplier when colliding with hay bales

Soft-break leaves on impact
Broken leaves are non-solid and slow your flight, but grow again with time

Minimum required speed to break leaves
Setting this too low will make landing on trees harder

Fixed chance of breaking leaves on impact
Can be negative (subtracts to linear chance)

Chance of breaking leaves at§b 1m/s§r
Scales linearly with speed
Adds to the constant chance
Motion multiplier applied to entities inside broken leaves

Chance for broken leaves to regrow on each random tick
Redstone powered leaves or leaves colliding with entities won't regrow
Players flying into slime are bounced back

Minimum speed to bounce on slime
Setting this too low will make landing on slime harder
Friction applied to the tilt on each bounce
How fast do the strafing keys reach maximum yaw tilt
Invert Controls on Front Third Person
aerobatic-elytra.config.client.style.vis: Multiplies how much does the FOV increase when flying

Display a special crosshair when flying on first person,
which displays your current tilt on each axis

The Flight Bar shows your propulsion strength
You may choose to hide it, replace the XP bar when flying, or show it over the XP bar

How many seconds should the mode toast last
The toast appearance can be changed by resource packs
Horizontal toast position on screen in percentage
Vertical Toast position on screen in percentage

Even though the loom only allows you to
compose up to§b 6§r layers in banners, the game can
handle up to§b 16§r. Here you can expand that
limit exclusively for banners in Aerobatic Elytras
Where should the fuel be displayed

When should the fuel be displayed
The currently equipped elytra always shows it

Disable glint rendering in aerobatic elytra wings.
Helps see patterns in enchanted elytras

When should the enchantment glint display in the inventory
Helps see elytra colors
aerobatic-elytra.config.client.style.dar:
Use darker textures in GUIs
This includes the JEI recipe boxes
If you use a dark theme resource pack, such as %s and %s, you may enable the dark theme to use darker textures in the mod GUIs as well

Detect automatically enabled resource packs with a name suggesting dark theme support
Currently, if you change resource packs mid-game the change might not be detected

RegEx pattern used to match dark
theme resource pack names
aerobatic-elytra.config.client.sound:hel:
Control the volume of all mod sounds
Resource packs may alter these sounds
aerobatic-elytra.config.client.sound.win: Affects the wind sound heard while flying
aerobatic-elytra.config.client.sound.rot:
Affects the wind sound heard while
quickly rotating in the air
aerobatic-elytra.config.client.sound.boo:
Affects the boost sounds, both when
accelerating and slowing down
aerobatic-elytra.config.client.sound.bra: Affects the wind sound heard while braking
aerobatic-elytra.config.client.sound.whi: Affects the whistling sound heard while flying very fast
aerobatic-elytra.config.text.datapack_ti:
Use datapacks for recipe and loot configuration. Example template datapacks come bundled with the mod
Try typing the command "%s" to get suggestions.
It's possible to replace the elytra found in end ships using a loot table.
aerobatic-elytra.config.warning.speed_ca: Flying too fast!: %s m/s. Aerobatic Elytra config might be broken
